place.name: GARTHBRENGI
place.gazetteerText: GARTHBRENGY, a parish in the district and county of Brecon; on the river Honddu, 3 miles N of Brecon town and r. station. Post town, Brecon. Acres, 2, 001. Real property, £678. Pop., 162. Houses, 35. The property is divided among a few. The surface rises. abruptly from the Honddu. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £102. Patron, the Bishop of St. Davids. The church is ancient; and the roof of it was recently in bad condition. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
